OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and diagnose the elderly patient presenting for an annual blood pressure visit with incidental lab findings.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents for his annual blood pressure visit with no complaints other than occasional knee pain. He has a past medical history of hypertension and knee osteoarthritis, for which he takes occasional acetaminophen.
Patient_Actor.Social_History: Diet rich in vegetables, daily exercise, no history of smoking. A brother died at 84 due to hematologic malignancy.
Patient_Actor.Review_of_Systems: Denies headache, dizziness, chest pain, palpitations, dyspnea, fever, weight loss, or night sweats.

Musculoskeletal_Examination.Range_of_Motion: Reduced range of motion in both knees.
Musculoskeletal_Examination.Palpation: Crepitus noted in both knees, no swelling or warmth.

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate a 75-year-old man presenting for an annual check-up, focusing on blood pressure management and interpreting laboratory test results.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient reports coming in for his annual blood pressure check-up. He has a history of hypertension and knee osteoarthritis. For his osteoarthritis, he occasionally takes acetaminophen. The patient mentions occasional knee pain but has no other complaints. He follows a diet rich in vegetables and exercises daily. Additionally, he has a family history of hematologic malignancy in a brother who died at the age of 84.
Patient_Actor.Social_History: Non-smoker, exercises daily, and follows a vegetable-rich diet.
Patient_Actor.Review_of_Systems: No additional complaints or symptoms noted.

Musculoskeletal_Examination.Knees: Reduced range of motion and crepitus noted in both knees indicating osteoarthritis.
